com.viaoa.comm.ssl

Class SSLBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.viaoa.comm.ssl.SSLBase
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SSLClient, SSLServer

    public abstract class SSLBase
extends Object
    SSL base class used by client and server to be able to send/receive data that is first encrypted.
    Author:
    vvia

    • Field Summary

      protected void log(String msg) 
      void output(byte[] bs, int offset, int len)
      This is the only way to send data to the client computer.
      protected void receiveInput(byte[] bs, int offset, int len)
      This is unencrypted data from the client, called from input(..)

      This will reset and cause the SSL handshaking to have to be done again.

      • resetSSL

        public void resetSSL()
              throws Exception
        This will reset and cause the SSL handshaking to have to be done again. Should not be needed, except for testing.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
                throws Exception
        This can be called to initialize the SSLEngine, etc. This is not required.
        Throws:
        Exception

        protected abstract void sendOutput(byte[] bs,
                                   int offset,
                                   int len,
                                   boolean bHandshakeOnly)
                            throws Exception
        This is the encrypted data that needs to go to the client. This should be overwritten to call the SSLCLient input(..) method.
